European Court of Human Rights Watch

item.title: ECTHRwatch submission
item.description: This page is currently empty and might be updated later. I first need to redact some information from what was submitted to the Court since the Court’s records pertaining to this case, V.L.C. v. France (50552/22) have been sealed. (104) A crucial element for future criminal investigations to determine is the potential connection between Judge Perrine Robert and the then Procureur Général of the Appeal Court, Marc Robert. If such a relationship exists, it would further implicate the Appeal Court in neglecting its duties, especially given their awareness of the lies perpetuated by the legal aid attorney assigned to my case.

item.title: Request for anonymity - European Court of Human Rights - McDonald’s RICO case
item.description: Click on this link to visualize the original document: request_for_anonymity_2022-11-01_Redacted.pdf This request for anonymity was submitted to the European Court of Human Rights by fax to +33 390214350 on October 31, 2022, at 17:06:23 (GMT), or November 01, 2022, at 01:06 (am) Beijing time. My request for anonymity was approved by the European Court of Human Rights on November 02, 2022. However, I didn’t receive the notification by email they claim to have sent me on that day.

item.title: Request for interim measures - European Court of Human Rights - McDonald’s RICO case
item.description: Click on this link to visualize the original email: request_for_interim_measures_2022-10-31_Redacted.pdf This request for interim measures was submitted to the European Court of Human Rights by fax to +33 390214350 on October 31, 2022, at 15:09:09 (GMT), or 23:09 Beijing time.
